file_content.text: You've completed the rite of death and rebirth. I have nothing more to teach you.
This rite is now over. You have died and been reborn. You've walked the path of Revan.
Leave now, and may the Force make you strong.
You return. Dripping with the blood of the womb, you are reborn.
Your old life, everything you were--all of it is dead, buried inside that cave.
What was that place? It was... strange.
The cave?
Darth Revan's shrine. Every piece of Revan's life that we've recovered is in that cave. It's the last thing initiates see before dying.
I don't get it.
In the cave, you died. You stand before me made anew.
Uh-huh.
You're free now. Free of everything you once were. Savor the moment. It won't come again.
Tell me how it feels. Your obligations have vanished, your past no longer burdens you... how does it feel to see the world reborn?
It feels different. Just... different.
Strange.
So it should.
Like I've never killed before.
It feels glorious.
Like the power of the Force flows through me.
It feels glorious.
Abandoning my obligations isn't that easy. Still... it's not a bad feeling.
Complicated, but good.
Feels like it's time to hunt.
Seems good.
I don't feel anything.
There's nothing.
There's no shame in that. When Revan died, the rebirth took many months--it will be no different with you.
You've done well. And I'm proud that you've begun your new life as a Revanite--choosing allegiance to us first of all.
Take this gift to guide you in your new life. It will remind you of what you've become.
I assure you--I will be a faithful Revanite.
It'll help me in the order.
I believe you will.
Much obliged.
You can't buy my loyalty to this cult.
Don't try bribing me.
I would never try.
The watchers say you have not been to the cave. Do not return until you've completed the trial of death.
Come here. Come closer. You are among the initiates who wish to join our order--and this is good.
But tell me something: You are here because of the Order of Revan. Are you ready to die for us?
If that's what the order requires.
Yes.
So very eager. But not so very wise.
What?
Are you looking for a fight, old man?
Is that a threat?
No. I'm only asking a question.
Consider carefully, for every Revanite must face a trial of death--just as Revan died at the hands of Jedi and Sith.
Death freed Revan, left him unbound from all oaths and promises. It paved his road to rebirth. Will death free you from your past?
One way or the other, I'm ready to find out.
Let's see.
My past does not bind me. My chains are already broken.
I don't need freeing.
I left my past behind when I became Sith.
I don't need freeing.
Then you have nothing to fear.
I serve the Empire. I doubt even death would free me from that.
Probably not.
No? You might be surprised. Leave your old life behind, and let your allegiances die with it.
Anything's possible--but I'm pretty free already.
Maybe.
Let me be clear--I'm not going to die.
Don't be stupid.
Do not be frightened. Change is nothing to fear.
Before us is a path. Beyond the path is a cave--a cave dedicated to Darth Revan.
Initiates fall on the path. Initiates are torn apart by things inside the cave. But initiates who reach the end are reborn. Remade.
You expect me to go to this cave?
You're sending me there?
I expect nothing of you. The choice--to walk the path of Revan or to return to the life you left--is yours.
Keep going.
Go, and you'll see.
Your superstition doesn't impress me.
Foolish cultist.
Then cower in the compound until the guards throw you out. We don't need Revanites who can't prove their worth.
Or... are you willing to do what is necessary?
The path is here. The cave... the cave will be more trying.
Very well.
Go. Free yourself from the life you've made. The petty choices, the mistakes, the oaths sworn--all of it will be washed away.
It will be terrible. It will be glorious. When the deed is done and you have reached the end of the cave, return to me.
I enjoy a hard trial.
Remember--survival is not your goal. Trust in the path of Darth Revan.
We have nothing more to discuss. Go, and return to me when you reach the end of the cave.
I'm not going to your stupid cave.
I won't do it.
Then you will always be mired in the life you've made until now. The petty choices, the oaths sworn, all of it.
You will never be free to become a Revanite. Not unless you do this.
You should not be here.
